# Who we are block/section

## What is YEP:

The Youth Employment Program is a non-profit organization building our next generation into outstanding leaders who productively support our local communities

We depend on \[bringing fourth, developing] members and citizens that deliver excellence through their principles and learned skills to improve our societies.

We forge our sovereign stewards from the wilderness of the Rocky Mountains and High Divide, and temper them in the Missouri Headwaters.

# Mission

## YEP's mission:

To engage in activities to educate, promote, and develop youth employment, work ethics, job skills, values, self-esteem, life skills, and career development; providing diverse and enriched youth employment options for participants. To assist \[in] the area youth develop into outstanding citizens, who are responsible and productive members of the regional workforce, and to create lasting impacts in our communities and ecosystems.

## Track our progress:

* 123 miles animal friendly fencing
* 456 small stream structures
* 246 acres animal surveys
* 579 acres plant surveys

# \[Our Team/Leadership]

YEP is overflowing with great personalities actively engaged in supporting the leadership of tomorrow's communities. We shine by polishing our workforce and ourselves through fun and challenging work in the outdoors. We are compelled to forge lasting \[friendships/relationships] and memories through work driven experiences and Technical Career Training(link).

# Partners

YEP has built meaningful relationships with a number of our partner organizations.

These organizations share our mission or have dedicated themselves to \[aid/help] us in our mission to develop outstanding leaders for our communities and ecosystems
